meanings.definition: A photograph taken with a shadow cast by the subject.
meanings.sent1: The shadowgraph captured the silhouette of the tree perfectly.
meanings.sent2: I love looking at old shadowgraphs of my family from the past.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to photobomb the shadowgraph, creating a funny image.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like faded shadowgraphs, hinting at the past.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a unique technique to create a stunning shadowgraph of the city skyline.

meanings.definition: A method of visualizing fluid flow using shadows.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use shadowgraphs to study how liquids move in different conditions.
meanings.sent2: The shadowgraph revealed the intricate patterns formed by the flowing water.
meanings.sent3: The playful children pretended the shadowgraph was a magical river on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The shadowgraph of the swirling tea in the cup resembled a whirlpool in miniature.
meanings.sent5: The shadowgraph technique helped uncover hidden details in the fluid dynamics experiment.

meanings.definition: An image produced by casting shadows on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a beautiful shadowgraph by arranging objects to cast shadows.
meanings.sent2: The shadowgraph on the wall looked like a mysterious figure in the dim light.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child made funny shadowgraphs with their hands on the projector screen.
meanings.sent4: The shadowgraph of the tree branches on the ground resembled a delicate lace pattern.
meanings.sent5: The shadowgraph of the bird in flight against the sunset was a breathtaking sight.
